The New Gym has 10 clubs across Viet Nam, we continue to expand as our mission is to breakdown barriers for everyone in Viet Nam. You can find club here.

With a practice area of nearly 2,000 square meters. Divided into 6 main training areas: Cardio training area (Cardio), Strength training area (Strength), Free weights training area, Functional training area (Functional), Exercise class group (Studio), Stretching area (Stretching).

It’s normal to feel out of place when trying something new, or even to feel overwhelmed or scared when it seems like other people know what they’re doing, but remember, everyone is a person start.

Resist the temptation to go straight to the cardio or use equipment you know and discover how to use simple exercise equipment! Whether you’re new to exercise or want to try a new strength training program, you’ll always feel confident in the gym. If you’re a cardio buff and are considering getting into weightlifting, did you know that research has shown that strength training can also boost heart health, walking speed, and efficiency? your overall physical performance? The gym system at The New Gym is fully equipped so you can start your training journey, or you can always ask for training support from The New Gym’s personal trainer.

I. Cardio – Cardio

II. Strength training area – Strength

III. Free Weights – Free Weights

IV. The gym system includes a functional exercise area – Functional

V. Our clubs at The New Gym always have the Studio

I. Training zones: Cardio

By training this area, you can build stronger muscles, including heart muscle, help control blood pressure, boost HDL (good cholesterol), reduce anxiety and stress, and reduce protein and cholesterol. Fats in the blood contribute to blood clots, prevent heart disease, lower blood sugar and control diabetes.

In addition, it also helps to promote brain health, increase metabolic rate, and regulate weight.

 

Check out the cardio exercises at Youtube The New Gym.

 

II. Strength training area – Strength

This is the place to train and develop muscle groups with cable movements. Strength exercises use opposing force to make muscles stronger. In addition to the benefits it gives you in your sense of self, resistance training is important for preventing and treating myasthenia gravis and osteoporosis by helping to maintain muscle and bone mass as we age. Go. Gym system is equipped with the latest equipment imported from Europe.

 

III. Free Weights – Free Weights

All gyms have free weights, which is a form of strength training that can be defined as resistance exercises delivered by ‘free’ objects that aren’t attached to anything. anything and you can completely pick up and move. These include items like medicine balls, barbells, dumbbells, kettlebells, sandbags, resistance bands, and sand dumbbells. They are used to tone and build muscle, which in turn help lower cholesterol and blood pressure levels, stabilize blood sugar, and encourage hormone health and bone density.

 

IV. The gym system includes a functional exercise area – Functional

Functional exercises typically use the whole body – the muscles are the main ones – and emphasize core strength and stability.

By mimicking movements in your everyday life, such as squatting, reaching, or even carrying a heavy object, building functional strength can help enhance your quality of life. and reduce the risk of injury.

 

V. System of gyms with group practice classes – Studio

In the studio you can join group classes, from Yoga, Aerobics to Dance, you will find intense or relaxing classes. And you’ll find that our engaging instructors and supportive classroom environment provide the perfect combination of motivation and fun! You can easily view the schedule through The New Gym app.
